arts.ttl: Frank Lampard provides Coventry City transfer update in wake of Chelsea loan link
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. Coventry City fans are going to have to wait a bit longer for Frank Lampard to make his first new signing since taking charge of the club after the head coach admits there’s “nothing imminent” in terms of fresh arrivals.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard rues 'really random' incident as 'character' sees Coventry City through in FA Cup
arts.sum: Frank Lampard was pleased with the character of his young players as Coventry City booked their place in the fourth round of the FA Cup with a 4-3 penalty shootout win over Championship rivals Sheffield Wednesday. “Some games the story is just what it is and you end up with a really good feeling because the players show character to take penalties and then walk around and the fans are happy because they have seen a real cup tie.

arts.ttl: Coventry City FA Cup player ratings after 4-3 penalty shootout win against Owls
arts.sum: Wednesday made five substitutions in the second half which helped get them back in the game and become more of a threat as City were forced to defend their slender lead, calling on Oliver Dovin to tip over his bar to deny Barry Bannan a late equaliser. Ellis Simms had a terrific chance to extend City’s lead early in the second half, only to hit his effort too close to the keeper before Victor Torp hit a shot from the rebound that was blocked when he looked favourite to score.

arts.ttl: Coventry edge past Sheffield Wednesday on penalties
arts.sum: Oliver Dovin saved from Olaf Kobacki to seal the Sky Blues’ place in the fourth round.

arts.ttl: Coventry City v Sheffield Wednesday live updates and team news from the FA Cup third round tie at the CBS Arena
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. The Sky Blues enjoyed a brilliant run in the famous competition they won in 1987 when they were an agonising VAR decision away from booking their place in the final last season, having taken a dramatic late extra-time lead against Manchester United at Wembley Stadium, only for Victor Torp's goal to be ruled out for off-side.

arts.ttl: Look no further than Frank Lampard and Coventry City for modern FA Cup tradition, writes TOM COLLOMOSSE... the competition will never be an afterthought for the four-time winner
arts.sum: TOM COLLOMOSSE: If you're looking for FA Cup tradition in the modern game, there are few better places to start than Frank Lampard and Coventry City.

arts.ttl: Coventry City boss looks close to home to boost numbers with transfer trigger option
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. The Sky Blues boss says the club are looking to formalise the return of 23-year-old Burroughs from Scottish Premier side Kilmarnock as well as 21-year-old Howley from Championship outfit Ayr United this month.

arts.ttl: Coventry City set for 'talks' with Chelsea as Frank Lampard looks to former club for transfer boost
arts.sum: Frank Lampard is reported to be lining up a deal with his former club Chelsea for rising midfield star Sam Rak-Sakyi to join Coventry City on loan for the second half of the season. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard sets out Coventry City's FA Cup stance 12 months on from Doug King demand
arts.sum: This time last year Mark Robins was told by Doug King that he wanted an FA Cup run and the former Coventry City manager duly delivered, guiding the Sky Blues to within millimetres of making the final. A self confessed traditionalist whose history and memory of the Cup goes back to watching his dad, Frank Lampard Snr, help lift the trophy for West Ham United when just a toddler in the 1980 final win over Arsenal, the head coach knows his own mind on such matters.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard on Coventry City’s ‘very strategic’ approach to January transfers
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. While the Sky Blues boss insists the club are taking a “very strategic” approach to their mid-term recruitment and not ruling out deals for the longer term, he admits he’d like fresh players in to help at this moment in time.
